EmailTemplate.name: RE: Happy New Year!!! (1389311070.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: Happy New Year!!! (1389311070.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Luana, Thank you for your warm wishes for the New Year – I wish the same for you! Great news about the project, we have a few steps left before we can move forward. · Statement of work – thank you for sending me what you have. I will need the billing information filled out and a client signature before I can activate your account and give you time and expense entry instructions. Could you give me a contact to reach out to at CHNCT so I can follow up with them to get this completed? · The next step is sending me a copy of your completed I-9. You can find the I-9 form in your enrollment documents; you will sign/date section 1 and a local notary will sign/date section 2 ( there will be instructions on how to complete this form in your enrollment documents as well.) You can send this back to me via email (I don’t need a hard copy.) I will also need you to send me a copy of your US passport (you can just take a picture with your phone and email that to me.) · I also need you to log in to MBO Access <https://access.mbopartners.com/> and complete the “Industry Expertise” and “Disciplines” sections of your profile. You can do this by clicking on your name in the upper right hand corner and then clicking on “Edit profile & privacy.” This information needed for our workmen’s comp. policy and must be completed before I can activate your account and get you billing. Your user ID and password is the same as your MBO Business Center. Please feel free to reach out to me with any questions.Thanks!Sara ___________________________________ SARA CONDEManager, Consultant ServicesMBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com From: Luana Vaupotic [mailto:luana.vaupotic@snet.net] Sent: Thursday, January 09, 2014 2:15 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Happy New Year!!! Hi Sara, I hope the holidays were wonderful and that the new year brings only good things. I apologize for not contacting you sooner. I know I will start working soon. CHNCT just contacted me, asking for my consulting agreement so I sent him the attached. I had a signed one to send back to you at one time but can’t find it. Anyway, the work should start about the time I leave the country. That should be exciting! We are leaving for Mexico on Saturday, January 11th. While we are in Mexico, I can be reached through this email or by calling a Connecticut number that rings in Mexico (203) 678-8009. If it’s urgent, my mobile number is (203) 214-9199. We will be back March 11th and after that time, the Connecticut house phone number is (203) 697-1199. I just realized, I’m not sure how to login to enter time and hours worked. If you told me before, I’ve forgotten. Could you please send that information so I can try from here before leaving? I hope your holidays were great and that the new year brings only good things, Best Regards, Luana <http://www.avast.com/> This email is free from viruses and malware because avast! Antivirus <http://www.avast.com/> protection is active.
